This allows the loop to continue moving forward in the array until it finds the target value. Once it finds the target value, the loop stops and returns the `id_value` variable, which holds the index of the target value in the array.

The invariant ensures that each iteration of the loop performs a valid check of the current array element at position `i` against the target value. It also ensures that once the target value is found, the `id_value` variable is updated with the correct index of the target value in the array.

Note that for the same program, if the loop variable is changed to its original value minus one, the array index in the loop invariant should be adjusted accordingly. So, if `p` is changed to `p - 1` in the loop, then the invariant should be adjusted to `arr[(i - 1)] == target` for the corresponding iteration.
